Initiated By: PRIVATE PLANTIFFS - FOOD CONCEPTS INTERNATIONAL LIMITED AND DEJI AKINYANJU
Other Relief Sought: A PETITION REQUESTING AN ORDER FOR THE FOLLOWING: 1.DEJI AKINYANJU TO BE REINSTATED AS CHAIRMAN OF FOOD CONCEPTS PLC (THE "COMPANY"); 2.PAYMENT OF ALL ENTITLEMENTS, SALARIES AND PERKS DUE TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMPANY BE PAID TO DEJI AKINYANJU FOR THE PERIOD SINCE HE CEASED TO BE CHAIRMAN (1 FEBRUARY 2016)
Other Product: PRIVATE EQUITY FUND INVESTMENT INTO PRIVATE COMPANY
Court: FEDERAL HIGH COURT, LAGOS, NIGERIA SUIT NO.: FHC/L/CS/1123/2016
Employing Firm: IDRIS IS A PARTNER OF DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS INTERNATIONAL LLP AND ALSO SITS AS A DIRECTOR ON FOOD CONCEPTS PLC, A PORTFOLIO COMPANY OF AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS I, LLC AND ADP I L.P. ("ADP I"), A PRIVATE EQUITY FUND ADVISED BY DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS INTERNATIONAL LLP
Allegations: ON 22 AUGUST 2016, ADP I WAS INFORMED THAT LITIGATION HAD BEEN FILED ON 18 AUGUST 2016 IN THE NIGERIAN HIGH COURT AGAINST FOOD CONCEPTS AND THREE OF ITS DIRECTORS (BASHORUN ODUNAYO OLOGUNDOYE (THE CHAIRMAN), IDRIS MOHAMMED (THE BOARD REPRESENTATIVE OF ADP I) AND ELIA ROUMANI (THE BOARD REPRESENTATIVE OF THE IFC)), (TOGETHER "THE RESPONDENTS"), BY, PURPORTEDLY, FOOD CONCEPTS INTERNATIONAL LIMITED ("FCIL") (THE LARGEST SHAREHOLDER IN FOOD CONCEPTS) AND THE FORMER CHAIRMAN AND CEO OF FOOD CONCEPTS, DEJI AKINYANJU ("DA") (TOGETHER, THE "PETITIONERS"). DA IS A SHAREHOLDER AND DIRECTOR OF FCIL AND IS ONE OF FCIL'S NOMINEES ON THE BOARD OF FOOD CONCEPTS.  THE LITIGATION INITIATED BY THE PETITIONERS CONSISTS OF:  A) AN EX PARTE MOTION REQUESTING AN INTERIM INJUNCTION RESTRAINING THE DIRECTORS OF THE COMPANY FROM HOLDING THE BOARD MEETING DUE TO BE HELD ON 23 AUGUST 2016 PURSUANT TO A NOTICE OF BOARD MEETING DATED 17 AUGUST 2016 (THE "INJUNCTION SUIT"). THE COURT REFUSED TO GRANT THE EX PARTE MOTION ON 22 AUGUST 2016 AND SET A DATE OF 31 AUGUST TO HEAR THE APPLICATION; AND B) A PETITION (THE "SUBSTANTIVE SUIT") REQUESTING AN ORDER FOR THE FOLLOWING: 1.DA TO BE REINSTATED AS CHAIRMAN OF FOOD CONCEPTS; 2.PAYMENT OF ALL ENTITLEMENTS, SALARIES AND PERKS DUE TO THE CHAIRMAN BE PAID TO DA FOR THE PERIOD SINCE HE CEASED TO BE CHAIRMAN (1 FEBRUARY 2016) 3.AN INJUNCTION RESTRAINING THE BOARD OF FOOD CONCEPTS FROM AGREEING TO THE CAPITAL RAISING PROPOSED BY THE FUND.
Summary: THE COURT HEARING WAS DELAYED FROM 31 AUGUST 2016 TO 25 OCTOBER 2016. THE COMPANY'S LEGAL COUNSEL HAS ALSO FILED AN AFFIDAVIT OF URGENCY.   ADP I IS LIAISING WITH THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMPANY AND IS ASSISTING THE COMPANY IN SEEKING TO RESOLVE THE SITUATION. THE COMPANY IS TAKING LEGAL ADVICE AND ADDRESSING THE ISSUES IN A PROACTIVE MANNER, IN LINE WITH IMPROVED PROCESSES IMPLEMENTED FOLLOWING THE CORPORATE GOVERNANCE REVIEW.   WHILST WE ARE AT AN EARLY STAGE OF PROCEEDINGS AND AWAIT DETAILED ARGUMENTS ON THE POSITION, THE COMPANY AND THE FUND ARE TAKING LEGAL ADVICE AND CURRENTLY BELIEVE THERE IS LITTLE MERIT IN THE CASE AND ARE HOPEFUL THAT THE LITIGATION WILL BE RESOLVED IN DUE COURSE.   ADP I WILL PROACTIVELY MONITOR THE SITUATION TOGETHER WITH ITS LEGAL COUNSEL AND CONTINUE TO LIAISE WITH THE COMPANY AND THE COMPANY'S LEGAL COUNSEL. FURTHER UPDATES WILL BE PROVIDED IF AND WHEN THE SITUATION IS RESOLVED OR THERE IS A MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE LEGAL PROCEEDINGS.

Initiated By: CIVIL DIVISION OF THE FEDERAL COURT OF JUSTICE OF GERMANY
Court: CIVIL DIVISION OF THE FEDERAL COURT OF JUSTICE OF GERMANY KARLSRUHE, GERMANY
Allegations: THE CIVIL DIVISION OF THE FEDERAL COURT OF JUSTICE OF GERMANY FOUND THAT DEUTSCHE BANK AG ("DBAG") VIOLATED CERTAIN ADVISORY DUTIES IN PROVIDING ADVICE ON ENTERING INTO AN INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT (CMS SPREAD LADDER SWAP CONTRACT) STRUCTURED BY THE BANK BUT NOT DISCLOSING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.
Sanction Detail: THE AMOUNT OF $541,000 IS IN EUROS PLUS INTETERST (AFTER DEDUCTING INTEREST PAYMENTS RECEIVED).
Summary: THE CIVIL DIVISION OF THE FEDERAL COURT OF JUSTICE OF GERMANY FOUND THAT DEUTSCHE BANK AG ("DBAG") VIOLATED CERTAIN ADVISORY DUTIES IN PROVIDING ADVICE ON ENTERING INTO AN INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT (CMS SPREAD LADDER SWAP CONTRACT) STRUCTURED BY THE BANK BUT NOT DISCLOSING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

LLOYDS BANK PLC AND OTHER MEMBERS OF LLOYDS BANKING GROUP PLC (COLLECTIVELY, THE "GROUP") ARE NAMED AS DEFENDANTS IN PRIVATE LAWSUITS, INCLUDING PURPORTED CLASS ACTION SUITS, PENDING IN THE US WITH REGARD TO THE SETTING OF THE BBA LONDON INTERBANK OFFERED RATE (LIBOR).  THE CLAIMS HAVE BEEN ASSERTED BY PLAINTIFFS CLAIMING TO HAVE HAD AN INTEREST IN VARIOUS TYPES OF FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS LINKED TO US DOLLAR LIBOR. THE ALLEGATIONS IN THESE CASES, THE MAJORITY OF WHICH HAVE BEEN COORDINATED FOR PRE-TRIAL PURPOSES IN MULTI-DISTRICT LITIGATION PROCEEDINGS (MDL) IN THE US DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK (THE 'DISTRICT COURT'), ARE SUBSTANTIALLY SIMILAR TO EACH OTHER. THE PLAINTIFFS ALLEGE VIOLATIONS OF THE SHERMAN ANTITRUST ACT, THE RACKETEER INFLUENCED AND CORRUPT ORGANIZATIONS ACT (RICO) AND THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT (CEA), AS WELL AS VARIOUS STATE STATUTES AND COMMON LAW DOCTRINES. CERTAIN OF THE PLAINTIFFS' CLAIMS, INCLUDING CLAIMS UNDER THE ANTITRUST LAWS, CLAIMS FOR UNJUST ENRICHMENT AND PORTIONS OF THEIR CLAIMS UNDER THE CEA, HAVE BEEN DISMISSED BY THE DISTRICT COURTIN ADDITION, CERTAIN OF THESE CASES HAVE BEEN STAYED BY ORDER OF THE DISTRICT COURT.  (THE U.S. SUPREME COURT WILL REVIEW THE U.S COURT OF APPEALS DECISION THAT IT LACKED JURISDICTION TO REVIEW AN APPEAL OF THESE DISMISSALS.)  IT IS ALSO LIKELY THAT THE GROUP WILL SOON BE INCLUDED IN SIMILAR PENDING LITIGATION REGARDING GROUP MEMBERS' ROLES AS PANEL BANKS CONTRIBUTTING TO THE SETTING OF JAPANESE YEN LIBOR.  IT IS CURRENTLY NOT POSSIBLE TO PREDICT THE SCOPE AND ULTIMATE OUTCOME ON THE GROUP OF ANY OF THE AFOREMENTIONED CIVIL LITIGATION

LLOYDS BANK BANK PLC AND OTHER MEMBERS OF LLOYDS BANKING GROUP PLC (COLLECTIVELY, THE "GROUP") ARE NAMED AS DEFENDANTS IN PRIVATE LAWSUITS PENDING IN THE US WITH REGARD TO THE SETTING OF THE BBA LONDON INTERBANK OFFERED  RATE (LIBOR). A NUMBER OF GOVERNMENT AGENCIES IN THE UK, US AND ELSEWHERE, INCLUDING THE UK FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY, THE SERIOUS FRAUD OFFICE, THE US COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION, THE US SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION, THE US DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE AND A NUMBER OF STATE ATTORNEYS GENERAL, AS WELL AS THE EUROPEAN AND SWISS COMPETITION COMMISSIONS, ARE CONDUCTING INVESTIGATIONS INTO SUBMISSIONS MADE BY PANEL MEMBERS TO THE BODIES THAT SET VARIOUS INTERBANK OFFERED RATES INCLUDING THE BBA LONDON INTERBANK OFFERED RATES (LIBOR) AND THE EUROPEAN BANKING FEDERATION'S EURIBOR, ALONG WITH OTHER REFERENCE RATES. CERTAIN GROUP COMPANIES WERE (AT THE RELEVANT TIMES) AND REMAIN MEMBERS OF VARIOUS PANELS WHOSE MEMBERS MAKE SUBMISSIONS TO THESE BODIES INCLUDING THE BBA LIBOR PANELS. NO GROUP COMPANY IS OR WAS A MEMBER OF THE EURIBOR PANEL. CERTAIN GROUP COMPANIES HAVE RECEIVED SUBPOENAS AND REQUESTS FOR INFORMATION FROM CERTAIN GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND THE GROUP IS CO-OPERATING WITH THEIR INVESTIGATIONS. CERTAIN GROUP COMPANIES, TOGETHER WITH OTHER PANEL BANKS, HAVE ALSO BEEN NAMED AS DEFENDANTS IN PRIVATE LAWSUITS, INCLUDING PURPORTED CLASS ACTION SUITS, IN THE US IN CONNECTION WITH THEIR ROLES AS PANEL BANKS CONTRIBUTING TO THE SETTING OF US DOLLAR LIBOR. THE CLAIMS HAVE BEEN ASSERTED BY PLAINTIFFS CLAIMING TO HAVE HAD AN INTEREST IN VARIOUS TYPES OF FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS LINKED TO US DOLLAR LIBOR. THE ALLEGATIONS IN THESE CASES, THE MAJORITY OF WHICH HAVE BEEN COORDINATED FOR PRE-TRIAL PURPOSES IN MULTI-DISTRICT LITIGATION PROCEEDINGS (MDL) IN THE US DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK (THE 'DISTRICT COURT'), ARE SUBSTANTIALLY SIMILAR TO EACH OTHER. THE LAWSUITS ALLEGE VIOLATIONS OF THE SHERMAN ANTITRUST ACT, THE RACKETEER INFLUENCED AND CORRUPT ORGANIZATIONS ACT (RICO) AND THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT (CEA), AS WELL AS VARIOUS STATE STATUTES AND COMMON LAW DOCTRINES. CERTAIN OF THE PLAINTIFFS' CLAIMS HAVE BEEN DISMISSED BY THE DISTRICT COURT, VARIOUS MOTIONS DIRECTED TO THE SUFFICIENCY OF THEIR PLEADING OF CERTAIN CLAIMS ARE STILL PENDING, AND MANY OF THESE CASES HAVE BEEN STAYED BY ORDER OF THE DISTRICT COURT. THE GROUP IS ALSO REVIEWING ITS ACTIVITIES IN RELATION TO THE SETTING OF CERTAIN FOREIGN EXCHANGE DAILY BENCHMARK RATES, FOLLOWING THE FCA'S PUBLICIZED INITIATION OF AN INVESTIGATION INTO OTHER FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS IN RELATION TO THIS ACTIVITY. IN ADDITION, THE GROUP, TOGETHER WITH A NUMBER OF OTHER BANKS, HAS BEEN NAMED AS A DEFENDANT IN SEVERAL PURPORTED CLASS ACTIONS IN THE DISTRICT COURT, IN WHICH THE PLAINTIFFS ALLEGE THAT THE DEFENDANTS MANIPULATED WM/REUTERS FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES IN VIOLATION OF US ANTITRUST LAWS.  THE DISTRICT COURT HAS ORDERED THE CONSOLIDATION OF NEARLY ALL OF THESE ACTIONS AND HAS RECENTLY SET DEADLINES FOR THE PLAINTIFFS TO FILE THEIR CONSOLIDATED AMENDED COMPLAINT AND FOR THE DEFENDANTS, INCLUDING THE GROUP, TO MOVE TO DISMISS THESE CLAIMS.    IT IS CURRENTLY NOT POSSIBLE TO PREDICT THE SCOPE AND ULTIMATE OUTCOME ON THE GROUP OF THE VARIOUS REGULATORY INVESTIGATIONS, PRIVATE LAWSUITS OR ANY RELATED CHALLENGES TO THE INTERPRETATION OR VALIDITY OF ANY OF THE GROUP'S CONTRACTUAL ARRANGEMENTS, INCLUDING THEIR TIMING AND SCALE.

Other Relief Sought: DISGORGEMENT OF ILL-GOTTEN GAINS AND CIVIL AND MONETARY PENALTIES
Other Product: SECURED CONVERTIBLE DEBT AND CONVERTIBLE PREFERRED STOCK
Court: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NY
Allegations: THE ALLEGED VIOLATIONS ASSERTED BY THE COMMISSION AGAINST YORKVILLE ADVISORS LLC, AN ADVISORY AFFILIATE (THE "AFFILIATE"), MARK ANGELO AS THE PORTFOLIO MANAGER OF THE FUND MANAGED BY THE AFFILIATE (THE "ADVISORY AFFILIATE FUND") AND EDWARD SCHINIK AS THE CFO OF THE AFFILIATE CONCERN (1) ALLEGED FRAUDULENT VALUATION OF CERTAIN PORTFOLIO SECURITIES OF THE ADVISORY AFFILIATE FUND IN 2008 AND 2009 AND (2) ALLEGED FALSE AND MISLEADING STATEMENTS IN 2008, 2009 AND 2010 TO CERTAIN INVESTORS, POTENTIAL INVESTORS AND AUDITORS CONCERNING AMONG OTHER THINGS VALUATION, COLLATERAL AND LIQUIDITY. THE COMMISSION ALLEGES VIOLATIONS OF: (1) SECTIONS 17(A) ABD 20(A) OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, (2) SECTION 10B OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER, AND (3) SECTIONS 203E(6), 206(1), 206(2), AND 206(4) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISORS ACT OF 1940 AND RULE 206(4)-8 THEREUNDER.
Summary: THE ALLEGED VIOLATIONS ASSERTED BY THE COMMISSION AGAINST YORKVILLE ADVISORS LLC, AN ADVISORY AFFILIATE (THE "AFFILIATE"), MARK ANGELO AS THE PORTFOLIO MANAGER OF THE FUND MANAGED BY THE AFFILIATE (THE "ADVISORY AFFILIATE FUND") AND EDWARD SCHINIK AS THE CFO OF THE AFFILIATE CONCERN (1) ALLEGED FRAUDULENT VALUATION OF CERTAIN PORTFOLIO SECURITIES OF THE ADVISORY AFFILIATE FUND IN 2008 AND 2009 AND (2) ALLEGED FALSE AND MISLEADING STATEMENTS IN 2008, 2009 AND 2010 TO CERTAIN INVESTORS, POTENTIAL INVESTORS AND AUDITORS CONCERNING AMONG OTHER THINGS VALUATION, COLLATERAL AND LIQUIDITY OF THE ADVISORY AFFILIATE FUND. THE COMMISSION ALLEGES VIOLATIONS OF: (1) SECTIONS 17(A) AND 20(A) OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, (2) SECTION 10B OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER, AND (3) SECTIONS 203E(6), 206(1), 206(2), AND 206(4) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISORS ACT OF 1940 AND RULE 206(4)-8 THEREUNDER. THE MATTER IS CURRENTLY IN THE DISCOVERY STAGE.

Other Relief Sought: DISGORGEMENT OF ALLEGED PROFITS MADE BY DEFENDANTS; EQUITABLE OR INJUNCTIVE RELIEF; MONETARY DAMAGES; ATTORNEYS' FEES AND COSTS.
Court: THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF MINNESOTA CASE NO. 16-CV-03002
Allegations: ST. JUDE MEDICAL, INC. ALLEGES THAT DEFENDANTS VIOLATED LANHAM ACT, 15 U.S.C. § 1125 AND MINNESOTA'S DECEPTIVE TRADE PRACTICES ACT, AND ALSO ASSERTS CLAIMS FOR COMMON LAW DEFAMATION AND CONSPIRACY.  ST. JUDE MEDICAL, INC. ALLEGES THAT DEFENDANTS ENGAGED IN MAKING FALSE STATEMENTS, FALSE ADVERTISING, CONSPIRACY AND THE RESULTANT MANIPULATION OF THE PUBLIC MARKETS AGAINST ST. JUDE MEDICAL, INC.
Summary: ON SEPTEMBER 9, 2016  MUDDY WATERS CAPITAL LLC ("MWC") WAS SERVED NOTICE THAT MWC AND CERTAIN OF ITS AFFILIATES WERE NAMED AS DEFENDANTS (COLLECTIVELY THE "DEFENDANTS") IN A CIVIL ACTION FILED BY ST. JUDE MEDICAL, INC. (THE "PLAINTIFF") IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF MINNESOTA.  THE COMPLAINT ALLEGES THAT THE DEFENDANTS ENGAGED IN FALSE STATEMENTS, FALSE ADVERTISING, CONSPIRACY AND THE RESULTANT MANIPULATION OF THE PUBLIC MARKETS AGAINST PLAINTIFF.  THE COMPLAINT SEEKS RECOVERY OF DISGORGEMENT OF PROFITS, EQUITABLE OR INJUNCTIVE RELIEF, ACTUAL DAMAGES, EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, AND ATTORNEYS' FEES.  DEFENDANTS INTEND TO VIGOROUSLY DEFEND THESE ALLEGATIONS.

Initiated By: THE CATALYST CAPITAL GROUP INC. AND CALLIDUS CAPITAL CORPORATION
Other Relief Sought: DAMAGES OF CA$50,000,000 AND PUNITIVE DAMAGES OF CA$5,000,000, ON A JOINT AND SEVERAL BASIS, AS AGAINST WEST FACE CAPITAL INC. ("WEST FACE") AND VERITAS INVESTMENT RESEARCH CORPORATION ("VERITAS").
Court: SUPERIOR COURT OF JUSTICE (ONTARIO, CANADA), COURT FILE NO. CV-15-530726
Allegations: THE PLAINTIFFS ARE ALLEGING THAT WEST FACE AND VERITAS ENGAGED IN DEFAMATION OF CALLIDUS AND A CONSPIRACY TO DEFAME CALLIDUS AND INTENTIONALLY INTERFERED WITH CALLIDUS' ECONOMIC RELATIONS WITH CALLIDUS' SECURITYHOLDERS.
Appeal Details: THE MAIN ACTION HAS NOT YET BEEN HEARD, BUT WEST FACE WAS SUCCESSFUL IN A MOTION TO HAVE A KEY ALLEGATION STRUCK FROM THE CLAIM.  THAT MOTION DECISION WAS APPEALED TO THE ONTARIO COURT OF APPEAL ON FEBRUARY 2, 2016, BUT A HEARING ON THE APPEAL HAS NOT YET BEEN HELD.
Summary: THIS ACTION ARISES FROM ALLEGATIONS BY THE PLAINTIFFS THAT WEST FACE AND VERITAS (AN INDEPENDENT INVESTMENT RESEARCH FIRM), EACH PUBLISHED RESEARCH ANALYSIS THAT DEFAMED CALLIDUS CAPITAL CORPORATION, A CANADIAN PUBLIC COMPANY LISTED ON THE TORONTO STOCK EXCHANGE THAT IS CONTROLLED BY THE CATALYST CAPITAL GROUP INC.

Other Relief Sought: GENERAL DAMAGES (WHICH WERE NOT PARTICULARIZED BY THE PLAINTIFF), AN ACCOUNTING OF PROFITS AS A RESULT OF THE ALLEGED MISUSE OF INFORMATION OF THE PLAINTIFF, AND PUNITIVE DAMAGES OF CA$300,000.
Court: SUPERIOR COURT OF JUSTICE (ONTARIO, CANADA) - COMMERCIAL LIST, COURT FILE NO. CV-16-11272-00CL
Allegations: THE PLAINTIFF ALLEGES THAT THE OTHER INDIVIDUAL DEFENDANT (A FORMER EMPLOYEE OF THE PLAINTIFF WHO WAS HIRED BY WEST FACE IN JUNE 2014) PROVIDED WEST FACE WITH CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION BELONGING TO THE PLAINTIFF AND ALLEGES THAT WEST FACE MISUSED THAT INFORMATION.
Appeal Details: ON OCTOBER 21, 2016, THE PLAINTIFF FILED AN AMENDED APPEAL OF JUSTICE NEWBOULD'S JUDGEMENTS WITH THE COURT OF APPEAL FOR ONTARIO.
Summary: THE ACTION WAS BROUGHT AGAINST WEST FACE CAPITAL INC. ("WEST FACE") AND BRANDON MOYSE (A FORMER EMPLOYEE OF THE PLAINTIFF WHO WAS HIRED BY WEST FACE IN JUNE 2014) BY THE CATALYST CAPITAL GROUP INC. (THE "PLAINTIFF"). A TRIAL IN RESPECT OF THE CLAIM WAS HELD FROM JUNE 6 TO 14, 2016.  ON AUGUST 18, 2016, JUSTICE NEWBOULD OF THE ONTARIO SUPERIOR COURT OF JUSTICE ("JUSTICE NEWBOULD") RENDERED HIS DECISION IN RESPECT OF THE TRIAL HELD IN EARLY JUNE 2016.  JUSTICE NEWBOULD DISMISSED IN ITS ENTIRETY THE ACTION COMMENCED BY THE PLAINTIFF AGAINST WEST FACE AND BRANDON MOYSE, WITH COSTS AGAINST THE PLAINTIFF.  ON SEPTEMBER 13, 2016, THE PLAINTIFF FILED AN APPEAL OF JUSTICE NEWBOULD'S JUDGMENT. ON OCTOBER 7, 2016, JUSTICE NEWBOULD RENDERED HIS COST ENDORSEMENT IN RESPECT OF THE TRIAL HELD IN EARLY JUNE 2016 AND HELD THAT WEST FACE WAS ENTITLED TO COSTS FROM THE PLAINTIFF ON A SUBSTANTIAL INDEMNITY BASIS IN THE AMOUNT OF CA$1,239,965. ON OCTOBER 21, 2016, THE PLAINTIFF FILED AN AMENDED APPEAL OF JUSTICE NEWBOULD'S JUDGEMENTS.    WEST FACE IS CURRENTLY MAINTAINING A WEBSITE AT WWW.CATALYSTLITIGATION.COM THAT HOSTS THE RELEVANT COURT MATERIALS FOR EACH OF THE LITIGATION MATTERS THAT WEST FACE IS DEFENDING AGAINST THE PLAINTIFF.

Other Relief Sought: DAMAGES OF CA$750,000,000, AND PUNITIVE DAMAGES OF CA$1,000,000, ON A JOINT AND SEVERAL BASIS, AS AGAINST WEST FACE AND SEVERAL OTHER PARTIES.
Court: SUPERIOR COURT OF JUSTICE (ONTARIO, CANADA), COURT FILE NO. CV-16-553800
Allegations: THE PLAINTIFF IS ALLEGING MISUSE OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION, CONSPIRACY AND INDUCING BREACH OF CONTRACT IN CONNECTION WITH THE ACQUISITION IN SEPTEMBER 2014 OF WIND MOBILE CANADA ("WIND") BY A GROUP OF INVESTORS THAT INCLUDED WEST FACE.  THIS CLAIM NAMES AS DEFENDANTS THE SELLING SHAREHOLDERS OF WIND, THE WIND HOLDING COMPANY, THE INVESTMENT BANK RETAINED BY THE LEAD SELLER OF WIND, WEST FACE AND THE OTHER INVESTORS THAT ACQUIRED WIND ALONGSIDE WEST FACE IN SEPTEMBER 2014.

Other Product: PRIVATE EQUITY FUND INVESTMENT INTO PRIVATE COMPANY
Court: FEDERAL HIGH COURT, LAGOS, NIGERIA SUIT NO.: FHC/L/CS/1123/2016
Employing Firm: IDRIS IS A PARTNER OF DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS INTERNATIONAL LLP AND ALSO SITS AS A DIRECTOR ON FOOD CONCEPTS PLC, A PORTFOLIO COMPANY OF AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS I, LLC AND ADP I L.P. ("ADP I"), A PRIVATE EQUITY FUND ADVISED BY DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS INTERNATIONAL LLP
Allegations: ON 22 AUGUST 2016, ADP I WAS INFORMED THAT LITIGATION HAD BEEN FILED ON 18 AUGUST 2016 IN THE NIGERIAN HIGH COURT AGAINST FOOD CONCEPTS AND THREE OF ITS DIRECTORS (BASHORUN ODUNAYO OLOGUNDOYE (THE CHAIRMAN), IDRIS MOHAMMED (THE BOARD REPRESENTATIVE OF ADP I) AND ELIA ROUMANI (THE BOARD REPRESENTATIVE OF THE IFC)), (TOGETHER "THE RESPONDENTS"), BY, PURPORTEDLY, FOOD CONCEPTS INTERNATIONAL LIMITED ("FCIL") (THE LARGEST SHAREHOLDER IN FOOD CONCEPTS) AND THE FORMER CHAIRMAN AND CEO OF FOOD CONCEPTS, DEJI AKINYANJU ("DA") (TOGETHER, THE "PETITIONERS"). DA IS A SHAREHOLDER AND DIRECTOR OF FCIL AND IS ONE OF FCIL'S NOMINEES ON THE BOARD OF FOOD CONCEPTS.  THE LITIGATION INITIATED BY THE PETITIONERS CONSISTS OF:  A) AN EX PARTE MOTION REQUESTING AN INTERIM INJUNCTION RESTRAINING THE DIRECTORS OF THE COMPANY FROM HOLDING THE BOARD MEETING DUE TO BE HELD ON 23 AUGUST 2016 PURSUANT TO A NOTICE OF BOARD MEETING DATED 17 AUGUST 2016 (THE "INJUNCTION SUIT"). THE COURT REFUSED TO GRANT THE EX PARTE MOTION ON 22 AUGUST 2016 AND SET A DATE OF 31 AUGUST TO HEAR THE APPLICATION; AND B) A PETITION (THE "SUBSTANTIVE SUIT") REQUESTING AN ORDER FOR THE FOLLOWING: 1.DA TO BE REINSTATED AS CHAIRMAN OF FOOD CONCEPTS; 2.PAYMENT OF ALL ENTITLEMENTS, SALARIES AND PERKS DUE TO THE CHAIRMAN BE PAID TO DA FOR THE PERIOD SINCE HE CEASED TO BE CHAIRMAN (1 FEBRUARY 2016) 3.AN INJUNCTION RESTRAINING THE BOARD OF FOOD CONCEPTS FROM AGREEING TO THE CAPITAL RAISING PROPOSED BY THE FUND.
Summary: THE COURT HEARING WAS DELAYED FROM 31 AUGUST 2016 TO 25 OCTOBER 2016. THE COMPANY'S LEGAL COUNSEL HAS ALSO FILED AN AFFIDAVIT OF URGENCY.   ADP I IS LIAISING WITH THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMPANY AND IS ASSISTING THE COMPANY IN SEEKING TO RESOLVE THE SITUATION. THE COMPANY IS TAKING LEGAL ADVICE AND ADDRESSING THE ISSUES IN A PROACTIVE MANNER, IN LINE WITH IMPROVED PROCESSES IMPLEMENTED FOLLOWING THE CORPORATE GOVERNANCE REVIEW.   WHILST WE ARE AT AN EARLY STAGE OF PROCEEDINGS AND AWAIT DETAILED ARGUMENTS ON THE POSITION, THE COMPANY AND THE FUND ARE TAKING LEGAL ADVICE AND CURRENTLY BELIEVE THERE IS LITTLE MERIT IN THE CASE AND ARE HOPEFUL THAT THE LITIGATION WILL BE RESOLVED IN DUE COURSE.   ADP I WILL PROACTIVELY MONITOR THE SITUATION TOGETHER WITH ITS LEGAL COUNSEL AND CONTINUE TO LIAISE WITH THE COMPANY AND THE COMPANY'S LEGAL COUNSEL. FURTHER UPDATES WILL BE PROVIDED IF AND WHEN THE SITUATION IS RESOLVED OR THERE IS A MATERIAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE LEGAL PROCEEDINGS.

Initiated By: PRIVATE PLANTIFFS - FOOD CONCEPTS INTERNATIONAL LIMITED AND DEJI AKINYANJU
Other Relief Sought: A PETITION REQUESTING AN ORDER FOR THE FOLLOWING: 1.DEJI AKINYANJU TO BE REINSTATED AS CHAIRMAN OF FOOD CONCEPTS PLC (THE "COMPANY"); 2.PAYMENT OF ALL ENTITLEMENTS, SALARIES AND PERKS DUE TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMPANY BE PAID TO DEJI AKINYANJU FOR THE PERIOD SINCE HE CEASED TO BE CHAIRMAN (1 FEBRUARY 2016)
